title: Lunatic
data:
The **Lunatic** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") specific to [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

Lunatics have intrinsic [lycanthropy](/wiki/Lycanthropy "Lycanthropy") like the [lycanthrope](/wiki/Lycanthrope "Lycanthrope") starting race, and also learn the same [techniques](/wiki/Techniques "Techniques"). Lunatics start with an extra square of vision similar to [Cavepeople](/wiki/Cavepeople "Cavepeople"). In addition, Lunatics get permanent [food appraisal](/wiki/Food_appraisal "Food appraisal") like [Chefs](/wiki/Chef "Chef"). Their starting pet is a [wolf](/wiki/Wolf "Wolf").

They can be a [doppelgänger](/wiki/Doppelganger_\(starting_race\) "Doppelganger (starting race)"), [drow](/wiki/Drow_\(starting_race\) "Drow (starting race)"), [giant](/wiki/Giant_\(starting_race\) "Giant (starting race)"), [human](/wiki/Human_\(starting_race\) "Human (starting race)"), [incantifier](/wiki/Incantifier "Incantifier"), [ogre](/wiki/Ogre_\(starting_race\) "Ogre (starting race)"), [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(starting_race\) "Orc (starting race)"), or [troll](/wiki/Troll_\(starting_race\) "Troll (starting race)") and are always chaotic. The [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees you fighting [Sir Lorimar](/wiki/Sir_Lorimar "Sir Lorimar") for the [The Staff of Withering](/wiki/The_Staff_of_Withering "The Staff of Withering"). It is a copy of [Lycanthrope quest](/wiki/Lycanthrope_quest "Lycanthrope quest").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Starting Equipment](#Starting_Equipment)
- [2 Techniques](#Techniques)
- [3 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [4 Skills](#Skills)
- [5 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [6 Gods](#Gods)
- [7 Lunatic rank titles](#Lunatic_rank_titles)
- [8 Origin](#Origin)

## Starting Equipment

- +1 [orcish short sword](/wiki/Orcish_short_sword "Orcish short sword")
- 2 [potions of sickness](/wiki/Potion_of_sickness "Potion of sickness")
- 2 random [scrolls](/wiki/Scrolls "Scrolls")

## Techniques

- XL 1: [Eviscerate](/wiki/Eviscerate "Eviscerate")
- XL 10: [Berserk](/wiki/Berserk_\(technique\) "Berserk (technique)")

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")
- XL 1: [Regeneration](/wiki/Regeneration "Regeneration")
- XL 7: [Stealth](/wiki/Stealth "Stealth")

## Skills

| Lunatic skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| -------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max            | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Basic          | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [paddle](/wiki/Paddle "Paddle"), [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe"), [morning star](/wiki/Morning_star "Morning star"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn")
- *Spells:* [protection](/wiki/Protection_spells "Protection spells"), [healing](/wiki/Healing_spells "Healing spells") |
| Skilled        | * *Weapons:* [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe"), [flail](/wiki/Flail "Flail"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms"), [javelin](/wiki/Javelin "Javelin"), [trident](/wiki/Trident "Trident"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling")                                                                      |
| Expert         | - *Weapons:* [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [mace](/wiki/Mace "Mace"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"), [bow](/wiki/Bow "Bow"), [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang")                                                                               |
| Grandmaster    | * *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

## Strategy

Lunatics have a tricky early and middle game, in large part due to their lycanthropy. An untimely polymorph can result in the player being unable to effectively react to certain situations well, as it severely limits the types of actions that the player can perform. Moreover, it can leave the player undressed due to their armor not fitting the form. If need be, a Lunatic can attempt to end the polymorph early by throwing items up at themself until they revert back to their original form by taking enough damage. This is only recommended if the player is in a relatively safe location, or are prepared to deal with whatever situation they are in after de-polymorphing. Gaining [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control") or a [means to suppress](/wiki/Unchanging "Unchanging") lycanthropy is an early goal of the Lunatic.

Lunatics have access to the powerful artifact weapon [Doomblade](/wiki/Doomblade "Doomblade") as a guaranteed [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift"). It deals a solid amount of damage on average by SlashTHEM standards and should help Lunatics bridge their way through the midgame.

## Gods

- *Main article: [Religion](/wiki/Religion "Religion")*

The pantheon is taken from the defunct Lycanthrope role in [SLASH](/wiki/SLASH "SLASH"), before that became a race.

- Lawful: Eluvian
- Neutral: Moon
- Chaotic: Lycanthus

## Lunatic rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

- XL 1-2: Infected
- XL 3-5: Summoner
- XL 6-9: Moon Worshipper
- XL 10-13: Render
- XL 14-17: Fiend
- XL 18-21: Nightmare
- XL 22-25: Devourer
- XL 26-29: Greater Fiend
- XL 30: Master Shapeshifter

## Origin

The Lunatic was overhauled to pay homage to the Lycanthrope role from [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6").
html:
Lunatic

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The Lunatic is a role specific to SlashTHEM.

Lunatics have intrinsic lycanthropy like the lycanthrope starting race, and also learn the same techniques. Lunatics start with an extra square of vision similar to Cavepeople. In addition, Lunatics get permanent food appraisal like Chefs. Their starting pet is a wolf.

They can be a doppelgänger, drow, giant, human, incantifier, ogre, orc, or troll and are always chaotic. The Quest sees you fighting Sir Lorimar for the The Staff of Withering. It is a copy of Lycanthrope quest.

Contents

  • 1 Starting Equipment
  • 2 Techniques
  • 3 Intrinsics
  • 4 Skills
  • 5 Strategy
  • 6 Gods
  • 7 Lunatic rank titles
  • 8 Origin

Starting Equipment

  • +1 orcish short sword
  • 2 potions of sickness
  • 2 random scrolls

Techniques

  • XL 1: Eviscerate
  • XL 10: Berserk

Intrinsics

  • XL 1: Poison resistance
  • XL 1: Regeneration
  • XL 7: Stealth

Skills

Lunatic skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: dagger, paddle, pick-axe, morning star, unicorn horn
  • Spells: protection, healing
Skilled
  • Weapons: knife, axe, flail, hammer, polearms, javelin, trident, sling
Expert
  • Weapons: short sword, club, mace, quarterstaff, spear, bow, boomerang
Grandmaster
  • Combat: bare hands

Strategy

Lunatics have a tricky early and middle game, in large part due to their lycanthropy. An untimely polymorph can result in the player being unable to effectively react to certain situations well, as it severely limits the types of actions that the player can perform. Moreover, it can leave the player undressed due to their armor not fitting the form. If need be, a Lunatic can attempt to end the polymorph early by throwing items up at themself until they revert back to their original form by taking enough damage. This is only recommended if the player is in a relatively safe location, or are prepared to deal with whatever situation they are in after de-polymorphing. Gaining polymorph control or a means to suppress lycanthropy is an early goal of the Lunatic.

Lunatics have access to the powerful artifact weapon Doomblade as a guaranteed sacrifice gift. It deals a solid amount of damage on average by SlashTHEM standards and should help Lunatics bridge their way through the midgame.

Gods

Main article: Religion

The pantheon is taken from the defunct Lycanthrope role in SLASH, before that became a race.

  • Lawful: Eluvian
  • Neutral: Moon
  • Chaotic: Lycanthus

Lunatic rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1-2: Infected
  • XL 3-5: Summoner
  • XL 6-9: Moon Worshipper
  • XL 10-13: Render
  • XL 14-17: Fiend
  • XL 18-21: Nightmare
  • XL 22-25: Devourer
  • XL 26-29: Greater Fiend
  • XL 30: Master Shapeshifter

Origin

The Lunatic was overhauled to pay homage to the Lycanthrope role from SLASH 6.

The '''Lunatic''' is a [[role]] specific to [[SlashTHEM]]. 

Lunatics have intrinsic [[lycanthropy]] like the [[lycanthrope]] starting race, and also learn the same [[techniques]]. Lunatics start with an extra square of vision similar to [[Cavepeople]]. In addition, Lunatics get permanent [[food appraisal]] like [[Chef]]s. Their starting pet is a [[wolf]].

They can be a [[Doppelganger (starting race)|doppelgänger]], [[drow (starting race)|drow]], [[giant (starting race)|giant]], [[human (starting race)|human]], [[incantifier]], [[ogre (starting race)|ogre]], [[orc (starting race)|orc]], or [[troll (starting race)|troll]] and are always chaotic.
The [[Quest]] sees you fighting [[Sir Lorimar]] for the [[The Staff of Withering]]. It is a copy of [[Lycanthrope quest]].

==Starting Equipment==
* +1 [[orcish short sword]]
* 2 [[potion of sickness|potions of sickness]]
* 2 random [[scrolls]]

== Techniques ==

*XL 10: [[Berserk (technique)|Berserk]]

==Strategy==
Lunatics have a tricky early and middle game, in large part due to their lycanthropy. An untimely polymorph can result in the player being unable to effectively react to certain situations well, as it severely limits the types of actions that the player can perform. Moreover, it can leave the player undressed due to their armor not fitting the form. If need be, a Lunatic can attempt to end the polymorph early by throwing items up at themself until they revert back to their original form by taking enough damage. This is only recommended if the player is in a relatively safe location, or are prepared to deal with whatever situation they are in after de-polymorphing. Gaining [[polymorph control]] or a [[unchanging|means to suppress]] lycanthropy is an early goal of the Lunatic.

Lunatics have access to the powerful artifact weapon [[Doomblade]] as a guaranteed [[sacrifice gift]]. It deals a solid amount of damage on average by SlashTHEM standards and should help Lunatics bridge their way through the midgame.

==Gods==
{{main|Religion}}
The pantheon is taken from the defunct Lycanthrope role in [[SLASH]], before that became a race.
*Lawful:  Eluvian
*Neutral: Moon
*Chaotic: Lycanthus

==Lunatic rank titles==
The [[status line]] shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

*XL 1-2: Infected
*XL 3-5: Summoner
*XL 6-9: Moon Worshipper
*XL 10-13: Render
*XL 14-17: Fiend
*XL 18-21: Nightmare
*XL 22-25: Devourer
*XL 26-29: Greater Fiend
*XL 30: Master Shapeshifter

==Origin==
The Lunatic was overhauled to pay homage to the Lycanthrope role from [[SLASH 6]].
